content.description: Start left hand pinching right side of a sloping ledge, right on low left leaning seam.  Move up to right-facing edge that is below the top.
content.location: Adopt-a-Boulder which is found by heading south along the trail found directly under the phone lines. Slopey Seconds is on the northwest arête.

content.description: Climb the overhanging side next to the path North West side. Sit at a sloping hold about waist height, left hand up to small crimp right to pinch seam then top out
content.location: Power Line group Horn-it.  Horn-it is the second boulder you arrive at from the parking area.

content.description: Sit start on the sloping shelf.  Climb up and over.
content.location: Same location as Rotary on Horn It

content.description: Climb up short vertical face on good holds.
content.location: It is to the right of Horn It Stand, vertical face.

content.description: Jump up to the horn and continue straight up on small edges and slab.
content.location: It is on Horn It.  It is to the left of the large boulder next to Horn It.

content.description: Start on two four finger crimps about head high. Slap for the sloping top. You will hind bad sloping edges above for top out.
content.location: Phoneline group on Adopt-a-Boulder which is found by heading south along the trail. This boulder is the last one in the area you come to and sits directly under the phone line.  From Colorado With Love is on the East face.

content.description: Start boulder that is split from main face on southeast side. Then low-angled arête leaning to the right.
content.location: On Southeast side of splitrock. Fallow trail from parking area splitrock is the first large boulder you arrive at.

content.description: Climbs steep overhanging face on southwest side.  Right hand right-facing pinch about chest height, left hand on sloping horizontal seam, Bump hands and rock onto the slab out right using crystals above a sloper.
content.location: Phoneline group on Adopt-a-Boulder which is found by heading south along the trail. This boulder is the last one in the area you come to and sits directly under the phone line.  Problem is on west side of boulder.

content.description: Sit start 2 hands on a slopping ledge right side of the crack/arête with bad smearing feet.Climb crack and arête to top.
content.location: On south side of splitrock. This is the first large boulder you come to on the phone line trail and the one you see from NY 28.

content.description: Flatrock Boulders problems are mostly on true boulders, some roped climbing on short cliffbands. Rock is fine-grained with quartz bands. Some areas are in swampy locations depending on rain and time of year. Summer can be buggy winters cold and snowy.  Most of the boulders are in dense forest so moss can be abundant.
